籤詩版本二:
The sword comes out of the box and shines brightly
No dust in the box at all
Now a noble person appears with you
Powerful and powerful, everyone admires you
詩意: This hexagram represents the sword coming out of the box. Everything is powerful and powerful.
解曰: The sword comes out of the box. Brilliant for thousands of miles. Noble guidance. Everything is beautiful.
籤詩故事一:
◇Zhao Zilong saves Adou
During the Three Kingdoms period, Zhao Yun, courtesy name Zilong, was a native of Changshan. At first, he relied on Yuan Shao, and then followed Liu (Bei), the first lord of Western Shu.
At that time, Cao Cao wanted to go to the south of the Yangtze River. He first attacked the former lord Liu Bei in Xinye (name of place), and the former lord fled to Fancheng. He was defeated again in Dangyang and his family members were separated. Zhao Yun met Mrs. Wei (Mrs. Liu Bei) under the earth wall.
The lady entrusted her son Adou (Liu Bei's son, Liu Chan) to Zhao Yun. Zhao Yun gave the horse to the lady, but the lady refused to accept it and threw herself into a well and died.
After Zhao Yun cried and buried his wife, he hugged Adou and fought his way out of the siege.
聖意:
House and home pray for blessings.
Good luck to itself.
Seeking financial gain.
Transaction completed.
Marriage Good.
Liujia Female.
Pedestrian: Late.
Tian Silkworm: It’s better to go early.


Six animals are damaged.
Looking for someone to meet.
Public litigation and.
Migration is booming.
Lost property South.
Disease returns old wishes.
Mountain tomb is auspicious.
